snippet: Scott Forstall, who has run software development for Apple's iPad and iPhone products, and John Browett, the head of the company's retail operations, are leaving Apple, in a rare management reshuffling at the company.
abstract: Scott Forstall, who has run software development for Apple's iPad and iPhone products, and John Browett, the head of the company's retail operations, are leaving Apple, in a rare management reshuffling at the company.

headline.main: In Shake-Up, Apple's Mobile Software and Retail Chiefs to Depart
headline.print_headline: In Shake-Up, Apple Ousts a Longtime Executive

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and NICK BILTON

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes a hardware challenge as laptop makers prepare for Windows 8 and light bulbs for the home that can becontrolled v...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes a hardware challenge as laptop makers prepare for Windows 8 and light bulbs for the home that can becontrolled via an app.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Wireless Light Bulbs and Windows 8 Hardware

snippet: A Denver businessman arrested on Friday on insider trading charges e-mailed his family and friends over the weekend, proclaiming his innocence and comparing his plight to challenges faced by Nelson Mandela and Steven P. Jobs.
abstract: A Denver businessman arrested on Friday on insider trading charges e-mailed his family and friends over the weekend, proclaiming his innocence and comparing his plight to challenges faced by Nelson Mandela and Steven P. Jobs.

headline.main: After Accusations of Insider Trading, a Profession of Innocence

snippet: The bookseller is introducing an advertising campaign in Britain meant to pull in customers there for the holiday season. It is emphasizing its new e-ink products, like the Nook Simple Touch.
abstract: The bookseller is introducing an advertising campaign in Britain meant to pull in customers there for the holiday season. It is emphasizing its new e-ink products, like the Nook Simple Touch.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Continues Push in Britain

snippet: With the addition of the iPad Mini, Apple offers touch-screen devices in three sizes. Now its competitor Google is doing the same with the introduction of a 10-inch tablet, a new smartphone and an upgraded seven-inch tablet.
abstract: With the addition of the iPad Mini, Apple offers touch-screen devices in three sizes. Now its competitor Google is doing the same with the introduction of a 10-inch tablet, a new smartphone and an upgraded seven-inch tablet.

headline.main: Like Apple, Google Now Has Devices That Come in Three Sizes
headline.print_headline: Google Unveils a Larger Tablet as an iPad Competitor

snippet: As more of us have access to the Internet and apps through our cellphones and tablets, advertisers are looking for new ways to reach us there, Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times.
abstract: As more of us have access to the Internet and apps through our cellphones and tablets, advertisers are looking for new ways to reach us there, Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Cracking the Code on Mobile Ads

snippet: If onscreen alerts from Mountain Lion for new mail and other things become annoying, turn them off in the Mac's system preferences.
abstract: If onscreen alerts from Mountain Lion for new mail and other things become annoying, turn them off in the Mac's system preferences.

headline.main: Q&A: Turning Off Mac Screen Notifications

snippet: The deal between the media companies Bertelsmann, which owns Random House, and Pearson, which owns Penguin, might draw antitrust scrutiny.
abstract: Announcement by Bertelsmann and Pearson that Random House and Penguin will merge ripples through the book publishing industry, possibly setting off a long-expected wave of consolidation as adaptations to the digital marketplace continue to transform the business.

headline.main: Random House and Penguin Merger Creates Global Giant
headline.print_headline: Random House And Penguin Merger Creates Global Giant

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER and AMY CHOZICK

snippet: Apple has no shortage of challengers in China. Chief among them is Xiaomi, whose newest smartphone is set to go on sale at half the price of the iPhone 4s.
